Package org.blockchainnative.builder

Class EventFieldInfoBuilder<TSelf extends EventFieldInfoBuilder<TSelf,TEventFieldInfo,TEventInfoBuilder>,TEventFieldInfo extends EventFieldInfo,TEventInfoBuilder extends EventInfoBuilder>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.blockchainnative.builder.EventFieldInfoBuilder<TSelf,TEventFieldInfo,TEventInfoBuilder>
  • Type Parameters:
    TSelf - Concrete type of the EventFieldInfoBuilder
    TEventFieldInfo - Concrete type of the EventFieldInfo to be created
    TEventInfoBuilder - Concrete type of the EventInfoBuilder used by this builder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EthereumContractInfoBuilder.EthereumEventFieldInfoBuilder, FabricContractInfoBuilder.FabricEventFieldInfoBuilder
    public abstract class EventFieldInfoBuilder<TSelf extends EventFieldInfoBuilder<TSelf,TEventFieldInfo,TEventInfoBuilder>,TEventFieldInfo extends EventFieldInfo,TEventInfoBuilder extends EventInfoBuilder>
extends java.lang.Object
    Fluent API to build EventFieldInfo objects.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    ContractInfo, EventFieldInfo, MethodInfoBuilder, ParameterInfoBuilder, EventInfoBuilder, EventParameterInfoBuilder, EventFieldInfoBuilder

      • EventFieldInfoBuilder

        protected EventFieldInfoBuilder​(TEventInfoBuilder eventInfoBuilder,
                                java.lang.reflect.Field field)
        Initializes a new EventFieldInfoBuilder for the given field and assigns the values from the metadata annotation EventField
        Parameters:
        eventInfoBuilder - parent builder
        field - event field

    • Method Detail

      • sourceFieldName

        public TSelf sourceFieldName​(java.lang.String name)
        Defines the name of the field as it is called in corresponding smart contract event.
        If the blockchain's implementation of events does not support multiple or named fields, this value is meaningless.
        Initial value is taken from EventField.value()

        Either the name or the index of the event field should be set, but not both!
        Parameters:
        name - name of the targeted event field
        Returns:
        this EventFieldInfoBuilder

      • atIndex

        public TSelf atIndex​(int index)
        Defines the index of the targeted field of the corresponding smart contract event.
        If the blockchain's implementation of events does not support multiple fields, this value is meaningless.
        Initial value is taken from EventField.index()

        Either the name or the index of the event field should be set, but not both!
        Parameters:
        index - index of the targeted event field
        Returns:
        this EventFieldInfoBuilder

      • useTypeConverter

        public TSelf useTypeConverter​(java.lang.Class<? extends TypeConverter<?,?>> typeConverterClass)
        Sets the TypeConverter to be used to convert smart contract event field value to the declared type of the field in the event object.
        Initial value is taken from EventField.useTypeConverter()
        Parameters:
        typeConverterClass - class of the TypeConverter to be used to convert the event field value.
        Returns:
        this EventFieldInfoBuilder

      • self

        protected TSelf self()
        Returns itself as the generic parameter TSelf.
        Allows sub types of EventFieldInfoBuilder to return the correct type from the fluent methods like useTypeConverter(Class).
        Returns:
        this casted to TSelf

      • hasBeenBuilt

        public boolean hasBeenBuilt()
        Returns if the EventFieldInfo object represented by the builder has already been built or not.
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating if the EventFieldInfo object represented by the builder has already been built or not

      • getEventFieldInfo

        public TEventFieldInfo getEventFieldInfo()
        Returns the EventFieldInfo object declared through the fluent API.
        Must only be called after build().
        Returns:
        EventFieldInfo object represented by the builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - in case the build() has not been called before.

      • build

        public final TEventInfoBuilder build()
        Creates the EventFieldInfo object declared through the fluent API.
        Must only be called once.
        Returns:
        EventFieldInfo object represented by the builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - in case the build() has been called before.

      • buildInternal

        protected abstract TEventFieldInfo buildInternal()
        Creates the concrete EventFieldInfo represented by the builder.
        Returns:
        EventFieldInfo represented by the builder
